channel.title: What happens under the hood? on A Tour of PyTorch 2.0
channel.description: Recent content in What happens under the hood? on A Tour of PyTorch 2.0

item.title: Inspecting torch.compile()
item.description: In this section we’ll define a very simple function and analyze what’s happening under the hood. import torch import math import os import matplotlib.pyplot as plt from torch import optim import torch._dynamo from torchvision import models from torch.profiler import profile, record_function, ProfilerActivity pi = math.pi device = torch.device("cuda") if torch.cuda.is_available() else "cpu" Define a simple function sin^2(x) + cos^2(x), as you know this equals 1 for all real values of x
